sections.description:
Create a drip feed 'Sequence' which are groups of posts/pages/CPTs where the content is revealed to members over time. This is a replacement for the 'drip feed content' module for Paid Memberships Pro (pmpro-series).

This plugin currently requires Paid Memberships Pro and started life as a complete rip-off of the pmpro_series lugin from strangerstudios. I needed a drip-content plugin that supported different delay type options, paginated lists of series posts, a way to let a user see an excerpt of the page/post, support a user defined custom post type,etc.

Added a features that weren't included in pmpro_series, specifically the ability to:

  1. Configure the sort order for the series/sequence
  2. Show/hide upcoming series/sequence posts
  3. Show/hide 'You are on day XXX of your membership' notice
  4. Show 'delay time' as 'days since membership started' or calendar date to end user.
  5. Admin defined schedule (using WP-Cron) for new content alert emails to users.
  6. User opt-in for receiving email alerts
  7. Templated email alerts for new content
  8. Pagination of sequence lists in sequence page
  9. [sequence_list] shortcode for paginated sequence list
  10. Widget containing summary (excerpt) of most recent post in a sequence [***] for the logged in user.
  11. Allows 'sneak preview' of upcoming posts in the sequence
  12. A settings metabox to simplify configuration (rather than only use filters)
  13. Filters to let the admin specify the types of posts/pages to include in a sequence, etc.
sections.changelog:
Please note: We recommend that you never deploy any plug-in on a live/production site without thoroughly exercising it in a test/development environment.

Click here to download the v2 based plugin. NOTE: Using v2.x means you will not have access to some of the v3/v4 related fixes and enhancements.

4.2.5

  1. Fix: Various problems with calculating the correct time for the next cron run.
  2. Fix: Plugin info Fix: Copyright notice Enh: Add modules namespace (preparation for dedicated content protection modules) Fix: Version number bump
  3. Fix: Update copyright notice
  4. Fix: Would sometimes load zero sequence members (posts) due to caching issues
  5. Fix: Confirm that there is a live cache entry for the user/sequence in is_cache_valid()
  6. Fix: Wouldn't load sequence posts if running as a cron job
  7. Fix: Simplify timestamp management/creation
  8. Fix: Bump minimum required PHP version to 5.4
  9. Maint: Escape backslash for JSON
  10. Maint: Updated .gitignore
  11. Enh: Initial commit of membership module base class
  12. Enh: Use constant for select2 library versions Fix: Path to CDN for select2 library Fix: Enqueue select2 CSS
  13. Enh: Loading list of sequence(s) and its consumers (users) in dedicated & filtered function
  14. Enh: No longer depends on PMPro to process cron jobs, but has default reliance on it (Upcoming: Decouple PMPro requirement)
  15. Enh: Better error recovery in cache management
  16. Enh: Use standard method for obtaining the cache identifier for the user/sequence
  17. Enh: Decouple most of the PMPro dependencies & use filters instead
  18. Enh: Enforce singleton behavior for sequence class
  19. Enh: Use static variable - self::$seq_post_type - to identify the sequence post type
  20. Enh: New filter for default sender email for a sequence: e20r-sequence-default-sender-email (returns email address, uses admin email as default)
  21. Enh: New filter for default sender name for a sequence: e20r-sequence-default-sender-name (returns a string, uses admin's display_name as default)
  22. Enh: New filter for user's startdate: 'e20r-sequence-user-startdate' (accepts startdate, user_id variables, returns a UNIX timestamp/seconds since start of epoch)
  23. Enh: New filter for days as member calculation: 'e20r-sequence-days-as-member' (accepts $user_id & $level_id, returns #of days (float or int))
  24. Enh: New filter to get the membership level for a user: 'e20r-sequence-membership-level-for-user' (Accepts a user_id and a boolean 'force' variable to indicate whether to read from DB or cache if applicable. Returns the user's membership level ID or false if not a member)
  25. Enh: New filter to check membership levels for a user id: 'e20r-sequence-has-membership-level' (Accepts an integer or array representing level id(s) and a user Id to check. Returns true/false)
  26. Enh: New filter to check membership access to a post id for a user id: 'e20r-sequence-membership-access' (Accepts optional post id, optional user_id and a boolean flag to determine whether to force a read from any DB table (if it exists).

4.2.5

  1. Fix: Would attempt to load sequence posts for users not logged in.
  2. Fix: Didn't include the title for the new content in alert(s)

4.2.4

  1. Fix: Didn't always allow access to a post that was supposed to be available
  2. Fix: The subject of email alerts used the incorrect date for the post alert
  3. Enh: Didn't have a default notification type (single post per alert)
  4. Enh: Use WP's time constants (DAY\|WEEK\|etc_IN_SECONDS)
  5. Enh: The replaceable value !!today!! didn't use the delay value of the post to calculate the date.

4.2.3

  1. Fix: Avoid using reserved variable names
  2. Fix: Extend WP_Error with E20RError class

4.2.2

  1. Fix: Didn't include all 'unalerted' content prior to the specified delay value when sending alerts to users

4.2.1

  1. Fix: Didn't always load the correct font while in backend

4.2.0

  1. Fix: Load template (or exit if template can't be found)
  2. Fix: Didn't respect settings for individual alerts for new content (not digest)
  3. Fix: Remove hidden/inactive code
  4. Fix: Correctly handle digests and single notification per post scenarios
  5. Fix: Add support for multiple or single notification message to user.
  6. Fix: Use actual sequence objects when processing notices/alerts
  7. Fix: Typo in template example
  8. Enh/Fix: Allow more than one post to be returned if there are multiple posts with the same delay value in the sequence
  9. Enh: Include post excerpt(s) when loading post(s) for/to a sequence
  10. Enh: Remove unused code from closest post logic Fix: Didn't always respect the notice type (as a digest of links or individual posts) for notices/alerts.
  11. Enh: Add support for sending one or more notices to user for a single day's worth of content.
  12. Enh: Add new_content_list template (Improved formatting for list of new content in the sequence).

4.1.3

  1. Fix: Didn't always select the correct key for the sequence cache
  2. Fix: Didn't always load new sequence data

4.1.2

  1. Fix: Generating warning message while processing delay configuration for sequence(s)
  2. Fix: Didn't always ignore unpublished/unavailable sequences

4.1.1

  1. Fix: Adding/Removing posts to sequence could result in JavaScript error
  2. Fix: Would sometimes attempt to process auto-drafts

4.1.0

  1. Fix: Searchable select box would sometimes stop working in backend
  2. Fix: More reliable detection of origination of add/remove post/page
  3. Fix: More robust error handling during remove post/page operation
  4. Fix: More robust error handling during add post/page operation
  5. Fix: More robust error handling during clear cache operation
  6. Fix: Display any warning messages after add post/page operation
  7. Fix: Avoid confusion when checking user access rights to a post/delay/sequence combination
  8. Fix: Extra training slashes for the autoloader paths
  9. Fix: opacity setting when fading the post as we hover in sequence history list
  10. Fix/Enh: Include warning messages resulting from add/remove operation
  11. Fix/Enh: Make add/remove operations more robust
  12. Enh: Add error handling as class: E20RError
  13. Enh: Add styling for 'clear cache' button position in back-end
  14. Enh: Add & load Error message class (E20RError)
  15. Enh: Force a sequence cache clean-up from wp-admin
  16. Nit: Refactor Controller class
